intro: Harveya kenyensis, commonly known as the Kenyan harveya, is a flowering plant native to Kenya. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Harveya kenyensis is noted for its compact growth habit and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
